Description: Floor fragment with turn to rim of East Greek pottery plate; groups of ridges on underside at both breaks; pale white-yellow slip on inside only; inside, zig-zag beteen glaze bands with added red bands lined in white at outside of floor, to the centre, in exergue. remains of palmette ornament with added red paint in exergue; above ,part of exergue line with dots above. Fine pale ochre (7.5YR 7/5)clay with much small mica and some small lime inclusions, fine pores.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
G. Schaus, CVA Philadelphia, The University Museum (2) pl. 4.7c. Schaus suggests East Doris, possibly Nisyros, as the place of production.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.703)
